H4912.def: = an utterance, often in poetic style, that has a specific message, such as an oracle, words of advice, wisdom, or mockery

H8010.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}; tribe of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}; ► king of Judah and {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}; given the name {L:Jedidiah<SDBH:יְדִידְיָהּ>} at his birth

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H2451.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H4148.def: = causative action by which deities offer primarily verbal instruction to humans, which may occasionally be accompanied by physical punishment, given as a result of misbehavior or to prevent misbehavior, ► aimed to teach the receiver (and sometimes other people as well) wisdom and good behavior

H995.def: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

H561.def: = words spoken by humans and deities; often remembered and recorded

H998.def: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

H4148.def: = causative action by which deities offer primarily verbal instruction to humans, which may occasionally be accompanied by physical punishment, given as a result of misbehavior or to prevent misbehavior, ► aimed to teach the receiver (and sometimes other people as well) wisdom and good behavior

H7919.def: = state in which humans are able to accomplish whatever they attempt to do

H6664.def: = state in which a weight or measure is correct or accurate, in accordance with a standard

H4941.def: = a situation where one party has a dispute with another party, and is looking for a legal ruling in which they receive what they consider to be rightfully theirs

H4339.def: = state in which an object has a relativedly flat surface, where people and objects can move without obstacles; ≈ associated with security and prosperity

H6195.def: = state in which someone is able to manipulate difficult circumstances in such a way that the outcome is favorable to the planner; ≈ sometimes used in a positive sense, but also used in a negative sense

H6612.def: = person who is easily influenced by other people, ideas or one's own passions; ◄ because of his/her lack of wisdom and experience

H1847.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H4209.def: = plan or strategy thought out by humans or deities to accomplish a certain goal; ≈ when used for humans, only used in a negative sense

H5288.def: = a young male, ranging from childhood to adulthood; ► often in the service of other people; ≈ typically regarded as healthy and physically strong, but also lacking the experience and wisdom of the {L:older men<SDBH:זָקֵן>}

H2450.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H3254.def: = action by which humans or deities add to an existing number of entities

H3948.def: = causative action by which humans and deities give verbal instruction to other humans, and by which the focus is on the communication of the message rather than the content of the message; ≈ often connoting persuasive or eloquent speech

H995.def: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

H7069.def: = action by which humans acquire an animate or inanimate object ◄ by means of a financial transaction or in another way

H4912.def: = an utterance, often in poetic style, that has a specific message, such as an oracle, words of advice, wisdom, or mockery

H4426.def: = words that express insolence and contempt for someone else

H2420.def: = action by which humans or deities utter words that are often compacted and well-formulated and that require wisdom to be understood

H2450.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H3374.def: = state in which humans experience fear

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H7225.def: = point in time at which an event starts happening

H1847.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H191.def: = pertaining to being foolish, which manifests itself in a lack of fear of God, unwillingness to listen to advice, much talking, and being unable to conceal one's emotions

H936.def: = state in which someone considers someone or something else unworthy of attention or respect, and shows that by his/her actions

H2451.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H4148.def: = causative action by which deities offer primarily verbal instruction to humans, which may occasionally be accompanied by physical punishment, given as a result of misbehavior or to prevent misbehavior, ► aimed to teach the receiver (and sometimes other people as well) wisdom and good behavior

H1.def: = direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort

H4148.def: = causative action by which deities offer primarily verbal instruction to humans, which may occasionally be accompanied by physical punishment, given as a result of misbehavior or to prevent misbehavior, ► aimed to teach the receiver (and sometimes other people as well) wisdom and good behavior

H5203.def: = process by which ropes that used to be tightly strung begin to hang loose

H8451.def: = causative action by which humans or deities offer instruction to (other) humans, ► aimed to teach the recipients wisdom and good behavior

H517.def: = direct female progenitor; ≈ associated with affection and loyalty; often extended figuratively to refer to other objects that are regarded as feminine

H3880.def: possible meaning: = flowers or leaves woven together into a ring; ► worn on one's head; ≈ associated with honor and beauty

H2580.def: = state in which someone or something is physically attractive; ► which may bring about a favorable attitude in others

H7218.def: = upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities

H6060.def: = ornament worn around the neck of people and animals

H1621.def: = the front part of the neck, ► around which ornaments can be placed; ≈ only used in wisdom literature

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H2400.def: = state in which a human being is responsible for a specified or implied offence, ► which results in a state of guilt which may require atonement, restitution, and retribution

H14.def: = state in which someone is willing to do something

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H854.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H693.def: = to go to a location where one will not be readily seen by others; ► and wait there for an opportunity to seize or attack someone or do something else that is supposed to be done when nobody else can witness it

H1818.def: = red liquid that circulates in the arteries and veins of humans and animals; ► used in rituals such as sacrifices, purification and covenant ceremonies, and never to be eaten; ≈ regarded as the seat of {L:life<SDBH:נֶפֶשׁ>}; human blood, when flowing from the body, pollutes the body and the land

H6845.def: = action by which humans hide themselves ► in order to attack another person

H5355.def: = state in which humans are not held responsible for actions committed in the past or for future commitments

H2600.def: = action by which someone performs an event as a favor, without expecting a reward or remuneration for it

H1104.def: = action by which humans or animals cause food to pass down from their mouth to their esophagus; ≈ often used figuratively to denote destruction and death

H7585.def: = abode of the dead, a place of darkness and silence, located deep in the earth and inaccessible, where there is neither compassion nor wisdom; ≈ regarded as a place that is never satisfied; often personified; going there before one's time is considered a punishment

H8549.def: = state in which an object is fully, unaffected and undiminished in its shape and form

H3381.def: = process by which objects move (involuntarily) from a place that is relatively high in elevation to a relatively lower place

H953.def: = a place where water wells up from an underground source

H4672.def: = process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for

H3368.def: = state in which humans or objects are considered valuable and desirable

H1952.def: = a large quantity of valuable resources, ownership of which affects the way people think and live

H4390.def: = state or process in which a certain location, container, or surface is filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H5307.def: = process by which humans, animals, or objects move from a higher level to a lower level, typically at a high speed and without control

H1486.def: = specially marked object, such as a pebble or piece of pottery, ► used in order to decide questions

H259.def: = state in which a countable entity is one in number

H3599.def: = receptacle, ◄ made of leather or cloth, ► used to carry possessions, including money

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H854.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H4513.def: = action by which humans or deities are unwilling to give or sell something to (other) humans

H7272.def: = the lower part of the lower limb of the body of humans, animals, and --by extension-- of deities, which in some contexts may include the full leg; ► used for standing and walking; ≈ associated with authority, and also used as a euphemism for the male genitals

14.gl: to keep (one's) foot from (someone else's) path

H4116.def: = action by which humans or deities act without delay

H8210.def: = causative action by which humans pour out a liquid or dry substance

H2600.def: = action by which someone performs an event as a favor, without expecting a reward or remuneration for it

H7568.def: = net of unknown size and shape; ► used for hunting birds and other animals, and also for fishing; ≈ associated with aggression and control

H3671.def: = part of body; ◄ of bird, insect, celestial creature; ► used for flying but also to give protection

H693.def: = to go to a location where one will not be readily seen by others; ► and wait there for an opportunity to seize or attack someone or do something else that is supposed to be done when nobody else can witness it

H6845.def: = action by which humans hide themselves ► in order to attack another person

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H734.def: = relatively narrow {L:road<SDBH:דֶּרֶךְ>} that connects two locations and facilitates travelling

H1214.def: = causative action by which someone severs a link between one object and a larger object of which it used to be a part

H1215.def: = possessions accumulated through advantageous transactions, in which part of the income can be kept for oneself, mostly achieved in an unjust way

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H2451.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H2351.def: = referent to the location outside of an object

H7339.def: = central part of a city where people meet and where civic and commercial activities take place, usually at the intersection of streets and roads

H7218.def: = upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities

H1993.def: = action by which humans, animals, or objects produce a variety of sounds, often associated with animals, but also with natural phenomena like the waves of a stormy sea

H7121.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H5892.def: = relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent {L:villages<SDBH:חָצֵר>}, {L:settlements<SDBH:בַּת>}, and {L:pasturelands<SDBH:מִגְרָשׁ>}; ≈ associated with strength and security

H6607.def: literally: opening up of words; hence: = causative process by which deities make words easier to understand

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H561.def: = words spoken by humans and deities; often remembered and recorded

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H4970.def: = reference to an unknown point in time; ► normally used with the purpose of finding out which point in time is intended; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that this point of time may never arrive

H6612.def: = person who is easily influenced by other people, ideas or one's own passions; ◄ because of his/her lack of wisdom and experience

H157.def: = state in which humans or deities experience a feeling of affection for a person, an object, or a practice

H3887.def: = someone who shows contempt for other people and ideas

H2530.def: = process by which humans or deities experience an eager desire for a person or object

H3944.def: = action by which someone shows contempt for people and ideas

H3684.def: = state of absence of wisdom, which manifests itself in excessive anger, talking too rashly and too much, sinful behavior, and laziness, ► and results in poverty, shame, punishment, and trouble and grief for other people; ≈ foolishness is thought to reside in a person's {L:heart<SDBH:לֵב>}; the behavior and treatment of fools is often compared to that of animals

H8130.def: = state in which humans or deities experience hostility towards a person, an object, or a practice

H1847.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H5042.def: exact meaning unsure; possibly: = process by which water flows in a rapid and plentiful stream

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H3282.def: = a linker introducing a proposition denoting the reason for what precedes

H3985.def: = state in which humans and deities are unwilling to assent to a suggestion or proposal

H7121.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H7181.def: = action by which humans or deities pay close attention in order to be able to hear what (other) humans might be saying, or to pick up other sounds and react to if needed

H5186.def: = state in which a relatively straight object is shaped into a curve

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

10.gl: to stretch out (part of one's body)

H14.def: = state in which someone is willing to do something

H1571.def: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H7832.def: = action by which humans give expression to a friendly attitude, joy and amusement with the gestures and sounds that normally accompany it; ≈ this is normally regarded as a good thing, especially when done with restraint, whereas a lack of restraint is often associated with foolishness

H343.def: = extremely difficult circumstances ► resulting in grief, poverty, sickness, and/or death

H3932.def: only used in poetry; = action by which humans or deities express their disdain of others with words, sounds and/or gestures

H6343.def: = process by which humans tremble or shake, ◄ as a result of a strong emotion of fear and concern for one's safety

H7584.def: = state in which buildings and infrastructure have been totally destroyed

H343.def: = extremely difficult circumstances ► resulting in grief, poverty, sickness, and/or death

H857.def: = to move to a certain location, seen from that location's perspective

H5492.def: = process by which a strong wind blows, ► causing destruction and inspiring fear; ≈ often associated with the appearance and intervention of God and used as a symbol of warfare and hardship

H6869.def: = a process by which humans go through extremely difficult circumstances, resulting in severe anxiety, ◄ as if one were confined to a narrow and cramped space from which there is no escape

H227.def: = referent pointing to a specific point in time, either in the past or the future

H6030.def: = action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

H7836.def: = process by which the color of an object turns darker until it is (almost) black

H8130.def: = state in which humans or deities experience hostility towards a person, an object, or a practice

H1847.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H3374.def: = state in which humans experience fear

H14.def: = state in which someone is willing to do something

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H6529.def: = produce from crop-bearing trees and plants

H7646.def: = process by which someone's desire for food is fulfilled

H4156.def: = action by which humans exercise their minds to determine how they are going to achieve a particular purpose

H4878.def: = process by which people turn away from someone they had pledged to serve

H6612.def: = person who is easily influenced by other people, ideas or one's own passions; ◄ because of his/her lack of wisdom and experience

H2026.def: = causative action by which someone takes the life of a person, animal, or plant in a violent way

H7962.def: = state in which humans live without fear or concerns, which is either or not appropriate depending on the situation

H3684.def: = state of absence of wisdom, which manifests itself in excessive anger, talking too rashly and too much, sinful behavior, and laziness, ► and results in poverty, shame, punishment, and trouble and grief for other people; ≈ foolishness is thought to reside in a person's {L:heart<SDBH:לֵב>}; the behavior and treatment of fools is often compared to that of animals

H6.def: = state of not being located in the place where it is expected to be

H983.def: = state in which humans live with confidence and without fear; ≈ often regarded as carelessness, especially when there is no mention of trust in YHWH

H7599.def: = state in which humans live a peaceful life and have nothing to fear
